make the head.ejs take a list of extra .js, so we don't load game.js on the homepage for instance
Choose inner sleeve color
description:
Sleeves for MTG cards can have different colors on the inside.

In the Choose Sleeve dialog, if they choose that the sleeves should be rectangular, then add a Sleeve Inner section.
Let them choose any solid color for the sleeve inner, defaulting to black.

title: Cards on table know how they got there
description:
For each card on the table, record how it arrived. It could have been Play, Discard, Exile (are there any other ways to move to the table?) 
Then on the Table modal, include this information

title: Choose Card Sleeve
description:
When we play MTG in real life, we put our cards in sleeves. This protects them, but more fun, it changes the appearance of the card backs. This app needs to let them choose the appearance of the card back.

On the /prepare page, the player can click a "customize" button that appears over the library card back.
That triggers a modal, where they can choose a color or an art card for the card back appearance.
When they choose one, the appearance of the card back changes. This configuration is saved on the Prep record.
Then when the Game is created, it's copied there. The appearance of the card back changes on the /game page.

To start with, they can choose from a small selection of solid colors.
Implement the entire flow with only that option available.

After that works completely, add a selection of an arbitrary color. Find a color picker component somewhere open source.
After that works completely, add a small selection of art cards.
After that works, let them paste in a scryfall link of any card.

title: Make cmd-z undo
description: Can we make it Undo the last move (same as the Undo button) when a player pushes cmd-Z or ctrl-Z on windows?

title: Let sleeves be rectangular
description:
In real-life MTG, our sleeves are rectangular, and slightly bigger than the cards.
Add to the Choose Sleeves modal an option for rectangular sleeves.
When the player chooses this, then all card backs and card images are rectangular.
The rectangles are larger than the usual card image by 8px, so 208x286

This will affect the CSS, so it will require declaring a CSS variable of card width and height, and changing all numbers that depend on that to be calculations. There are hard-coded numbers in the CSS that are based on card height or width, so this will be hard to figure out.

title: Put on Bottom in Random Order
description: When there is more than one Revealed card, add a button on top of the section. When pushed, randomize the order of the Revealed cards and put them all on the bottom of the library

title: Copy card including sleeve
description:
When a card image is copied, we are copying the scryfall image.
If the player has chosen an inner sleeve color, then including that inner sleeve background would let the player paste the copied image in a way that includes an outline showing who played this card, since different players can have different sleeve inner colors.
Can we put an image in the copy/paste buffer that includes the outline around the scryfall card image?
This will take some research

title: Customize command zone to sleeves
description:
If they choose an art card for the sleeve, analyze the art card image and choose primary and secondary colors for the command zone.
See: https://lokeshdhakar.com/projects/color-thief/#api

title: Document all modal types and their navigation paths

title: Mulligan Button
description:
When the game is started but before any card is played, there should be a 'mulligan' button which repeats the draw step, drawing the number of cards configured in Prep and sorting them again.
This requires saving that number in the Game

title: Base command zone color on sleeve

title: Make game IDs not guessable
description:
The game ID is currently a sequential number. That's nice in the database, but not good for the URL. It makes the URL of games very easy to guess.
Generate a sequence of a few random words for the Game ID. use that in all URLs.
You can keep the integer ID or not, what makes more sense?

Supports 8 game page states (no modals, card only, library only, library+card, table only, table+card, history only, debug only) and 4 prep page states (no modals, card only, library only, library+card). Makes testing specific UI states much easier without clicking through the flow.

title: Choose Playmat
description:
Let people choose their playmat.
Add a 'configure' button on the bottom right of the playmat on the /prepare page.
There, they can choose from six suggested art card images.
That image replaces the playmat background on both the /prepare and /game pages.
(so it has to be saved to the Prep and then the Game)

After that works, let them paste the link to any card on scryfall... but you have to rotate it to get the playmat image. Break that out into a separate epic if needed.

After that, let them paste any URL to an image.

title: Make the card modal stable to next/previous
description:
Currently if I search the library (for instance), there is a nice next/previous button to switch to the next card. 
If I push it, the card moves around. The various widths of the card titles cause this, I think.
Make the card hold still when I do next/previous

## Acceptance Criteria

### Baseline (BEFORE changes):
- Take screenshots of several cards with varying title lengths
- Record card image position, title widths, modal dimensions

### Fix Verification:
- Card image position (top/left/transform) stays constant when clicking next/previous
- Title widths vary between cards (confirms testing different lengths)
- Test cards: short (Sol Ring), long (Overwhelming Stampede), single word (Forest)

### Visual Regression Check:
- Compare screenshots before/after - appearance should be as good or better
- Check for unwanted side effects:
  - Title text not cut off inappropriately
  - Spacing around title looks correct
  - Modal size appropriate
  - Next/previous buttons haven't moved
  - Other card details (mana cost, type, text) not shifted
- Test edge cases: extremely long titles, single character titles

### Screen Sizes:
- Desktop (1920x1080 or 1440x900) - primary use case
- At 768px breakpoint - where responsive layout changes
- Below 768px (~600px or ~375px) - mobile/tablet view

title: Sort the drawn cards
description:
When a game starts, after drawing 7 cards but before returning the game page, sort the cards.
Put all land cards on the left. Put basic lands first, sorted by basic land type.
After lands are creature cards. Sort by mana value.
After that is everything else. Sort by mana value.

title: Add a play counter to the command zone
description:
In real-life MTG, we need to count the number of times a commander has been played. When they click the commander, add a 'play' button to the modal. 
In the command zone, add a 'plays' counter, starting at 0. Whenever they click 'play' on the commander, increment this

title: Draw cards to begin the game
description: When a game starts, draw 7 cards before returning the game page

title: Secondary command zone color matches sleeve inner
description:
If they choose an inner color for the sleeve, make the secondary command zone color match that.
The secondary command zone color is the background for the game title and the commander cards.
If that color is dark, then we need to set the game title text to white; if it's light, the game title text should be black

title: Add query parameter support for auto-opening modals
description: Support URL query params like ?openLibrary=true or ?openCard=5 to automatically open modals on game page load. This will make it much easier to test specific UI states without clicking through the whole flow.

title: Spectator Mode
description: Make a way for a person to access a game, with the ability to look at all the cards, but no ability to change anything

title: Animate played cards to the table
description:
When a card is played, it should fly from where it is to the table - currently represented as the top of the page
The 'play' animation doesn't work for hand cards currently.

title: Configure number of cards to draw
description:
On the prepare page, under the Shuffle Up button, put some text 'draw 7 cards' and a configure button. 
Or maybe put 7 in a dropdown. Let them change the number of cards to be drawn.
That gets saved on the Prep, and it affects the number of cards drawn when they start the game.

title: Animations that reveal movement
description:
I want to make clear to the player where a card is going every time it changes state.
For instance, when it is played, it leaves the hand and goes to the table. The response to /game/{id}/play/{card} can show it flying from its position in the hand to the 'table', represented by an image of a table on the page.
When a card moves from 'Revealed' to top of library, the animation can show it flying from its prior revealed position to the top of the library stack. similarly for moving to bottom.
We can accomplish this by sending as part of the /play (or similar) request the positions of the card and of the destination, so that the server can construct the appropriate animations.
This is going to be hard, but we can do it!

Look at all the different card movements involved, and pick the easiest one to start with.
Then have the user look at that for tweaking technique.
